title: The US government is asking the court to force Google to sell Chrome
text:
The US government asked the judge to force Google to sell its Chrome browser, in a measure aimed at combating the monopolistic practices the technology giant is accused of.
The request is a change in the strategy of the US government’s competition authorities, who have left the technology giants alone since they failed to break up Microsoft almost two decades ago of Google, which is linked to the Alphabet group By preventing the group from terminating agreements with smartphone manufacturers that make its search engine the main browser on those phones, and prevent it from using the their Android operating system, and in response to the government’s request, the head of global affairs in Google’s Kent Walker said that judicial officials “have chosen to advance the agenda of radical intervention.”
He pointed out that the proposal would “undermine a range of Google products. “
Last summer, a federal judge in Washington, Amit Mehta, convicted Google of illegal practices to establish and maintain its monopoly in the field of online search.

author: mediapost.com
title: YouTube Citations In Google AI Overviews Surge 10/17/2024
text:
by Laurie Sullivan , Staff Writer @lauriesullivan , October 17, 2024
YouTube citations rose in Google AI Overviews (AIO) by more than 300% since the beginning of August and 200% since September, according to data released Thursday.
Ecommerce-related YouTube citations have increased by 121% as the holiday season gets underway.
Jim Yu, founder of enterprise SEO platform BrightEdge, pointed to the ability for AI Overviews to summarize YouTube videos.
“Google’s AI will watch and listen to the video to summarize the content,” he said, suggesting that the AI technology caches content to make it easier and quicker to access.
“I think it’s integrated into AI Overviews and creates a bulleted list. It’s a natural part of the AI experience,” Yu added.
The growth in YouTube AI-related citations is significant for two reasons, according to the company’s report.

advertisement
As a user-generated content platform, it provides businesses with an additional channel to leverage their community's voice or directly build content that could function as a citation -- and sourcing YouTube is a clear demonstration of Google Gemini's multimodal capabilities.
Videos have been part of search results for years, but in these instances, texts such as descriptions or transcripts are used to rank the video.
BrightEdge has identified data in Gemini content, so the video can be cited to help generate an answer to a query.
Content in YouTube -- the second-largest search engine -- was cited as a source at least once in as much as 60% of the AI Overviews tracked by BrightEdge Generative Parser in September.
BrightEdge’s report pointed to video as becoming a dominant medium in AI-generated results.
Although ecommerce has not fully caught up, the rise in video content overall suggests brands need to prioritize optimizing video assets for YouTube to capitalize on the trend.
The data also identified volatility in shopping queries that fell from 37% in early August to 26% in late September.
As the holiday shopping season approaches, the data identified a trend where shopping-related queries have stabilized.
Yu also shared overall trends around shopping and ecommerce in Google Search. “Don’t over depend on AI Overviews,” he said. “It’s important to keep optimizing for traditional search content.”
As AI Overview and Gemini become increases in multimodal, it will become more important to have and optimize different types of content, he said.
BrightEdge also shared data on SearchGPT’s growth rate of 150% month-over-month.
It also now sends brands 4x more referrals than Perplexity and Claude, which grew 22% in the same month.

title: PMI Consultant Evolves into Universal Talk Solutions to Address Surge in Language Service Demand | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Florida - PMI Consultant, a cornerstone in business consulting, proudly unveils a strategic evolution to meet the evolving needs of its clientele. Bolstered by a remarkable surge in demand for language services, PMI Consultant is embarking on a forward-thinking transformation, creating a specialized division—Universal Talk Solutions—solely devoted to delivering comprehensive linguistic solutions.
The genesis of this transformative move is rooted in a substantial shift in demand dynamics. The year 2023 witnessed an unprecedented sevenfold increase in interpretation cases compared to business consulting, prompting a proactive response from PMI Consultant. Recognizing this significant trend, the company made the strategic decision to establish Universal Talk Solutions as an independent entity under the PMI umbrella.
"As PMI Consultant, we've always been dedicated to delivering exceptional business consulting and support to our community. The landscape changed dramatically in 2023 when we observed a sevenfold increase in demand for language services over consulting cases. This pivotal realization became the driving force behind the decision to create Universal Talk Solutions," explains Pedro Raphael, CEO at PMI Consultant.
Effective November 2023, Universal Talk Solutions will stand as a distinct division, catering exclusively to the rising demand for translation of documents, onsite interpretation, and phone interpretation for medical and business needs. This strategic shift positions the company to better streamline and enhance the delivery of language services, acknowledging the unique challenges businesses face in today's interconnected world.
"Universal Talk Solutions is more than a new name; it's a reflection of our dedication to providing seamless communication solutions," adds Pedro Raphael.
With a team of over 500 interpreters and translators, Universal Talk Solutions is well-equipped to meet the diverse and growing language requirements of its clients. The division is supported by cutting-edge technological solutions, including a proprietary CRM system, ensuring efficiency and precision in every language service provided.
"The decision to create Universal Talk Solutions was not only a response to demand but a strategic move to deliver language solutions with the same dedication and excellence our clients expect. This new division embodies our commitment to providing specialized linguistic services tailored to the evolving needs of our community," adds Pedro Raphael.
For more information about Universal Talk Solutions and its range of language services, please visit https://universaltalksolutions.com or contact (855) 392-2122.

PMI Consultant has been a reputable provider of business consulting and support services, earning trust within the community. Acknowledging the surge in demand for language services, PMI Consultant expands its offerings with the creation of Universal Talk Solutions, a dedicated division focused on specialized language services.
